modalities.speech: Chris from Beer Geek Nation reviews the Black Butte 23, a 10.8% porter from Shoots Brewing in Oregon, aged in bourbon barrels with orange zest, cocoa nibs, and chili peppers, with a suggested best after date of 2012. The beer has a big aroma with vanilla, oakiness, and bourbon character, and Chris recommends trying it fresh and again a year from now. The Black Butte 23 barrel-aged porter has a rich aroma with notes of dark chocolate, coffee, and orange zest, with a smooth and complex flavor profile featuring milk chocolate, espresso, vanilla, and bourbon characters. Despite a slight alcohol burn, the beer is well-balanced and shows great potential for aging, with a final verdict of being a great and complex beer. This bourbon barrel age porter is a great beer with notes of vanilla, oakiness, and spiciness, but the chocolate flavor currently dominates, hiding some of the nuances. However, the reviewer predicts that with time, the beer will mature and the vanilla and bourbon flavors will come to the forefront, making it a world-class beer.
